title: YMCA Changemakers
team: Michelle Sun, Rachel Legg, Spoorthi Cherivirala, Thien Le, Robyn Lee
summary: The goal of the YMCA Youth Changemakers project was to create program based solutions that can engage and empower youths to be changemakers in their community in both virtual and in-person spaces, introducing them to non-profit organizations that share their interests.

title: Campus Confidence Culture
team: Christian Manaog, Umang Bhatt, Christie Chang
summary: Campus Confidence Culture tried to understand what the causes of stress are and how measures can be taken to mitigate them. Through their research they had insight into the fact that stress is often caused through self-confidence issues. They developed a plan to encourage people to reach out to other people on campus who are struggling in an organic way and provide a continuous reminder that raises a student’s confidence without overwhelming them.

title: Children's Downtime at Homeless Shelter
team: Morgan Wagner, Kaixin Li, Zoe Haskell-Craig
summary: Children's Downtime at Homeless Shelter thought about how extracurriculars with friends and family that we often take for granted are important to development outside of school. These extra curriculars like sports and tutoring are things that homeless children might have less access to in shelters.

title: Homeless Employment Strategies
team: Jennifer Chou, Arnav Gupta, Penelope Mckeefry, Rriddhiman Bezbaruah, Sihan Dong
summary: Homeless Employment Strategies began with the goal of increasing employment opportunities to homeless individuals. However, through their research they discovered that opportunities were not the problem; instead once individuals got a job it was hard for them to maintain the position and also use the money wisely. They then looked at ways to help homeless individuals manage their money as well as provide accountability to incentivize them to save.

title: Homeless Outreach Project
team: Sarah Bien, Angee Aattar, Arman Hezarkhani, Lizzy Board
summary: Homeless Outreach Project worked with Operational Safety Net and the Pittsburgh Bureau of Homeless Services to create a mobile-web application to coordinate between 5-6 different homeless outreach organizations. The organizations all do outreach but there is little to no coordination between them which results in individuals falling through the cracks and not getting the resources they need.

title: Sexual Assault & Relationship Violence
team: Wangyuqiao Duan, Isabella Starvaggi, Carolyn Chheath, Ida Chow
summary: Sexual Assault & Relationship Violence looked at how to get victims of relationship violence and rape to take the first step and utilize the resources that are currently offered to help them.

title: Street Medicine Prescription DB
team: Christine Lee, Xinran Liu, Rachel Chang, Grace Lee
summary: Street Medicine Prescription DB worked towards improving healthcare for homeless individuals by making it easier for organizations to prescribe medicine to the homeless while they’re on the streets through building a prescription database for management.

title: Window Sealing Energy Initiative
team: Aliaksei Hauryliuk, Sujay Desai, Scarlet Tong
summary: Window Sealing Energy Initiative looked within the problem of environmental sustainability at the specific issue of heat loss and energy loss due to radiation that flows through windows. They worked on developing a mask to put over the window to limit the effects of radiation on the temperature inside of the building so that electricity is not wasted to maintain the temperature.

title: Homeless Liason Management
team: Habiba Shalaby, Margaret Reager, Madhur Singal
summary: Under the Mkcinney Vento act, each school district must have a homeless student liaison to manage the homeless children in the district. This often becomes unmanageable because of the number of homeless students. Homeless Liason Management looked to see how it can help the liaison manage this task.

title: General Children's Education
team: Grace Wong, Zichen Liu, Gabriela Salcedo
summary: General Children's Education gave young kids more exposure to a variety of different fields through programs that were inspired by "Hour of Code."

title: Home(less)
team: Team Lead: Emma Nicklas-Morris, Jeremy Xue, Cindy Liu, Christine Phang
summary: Home(less) is an advocacy/service project dealing with homelessness in Pittsburgh. Every week, students would go to a local homeless shelter and make mugs with the residents.

title: ReachOut
team: Team Lead: Sarah Bien, Hanruo Wang, Lizzy Board, Riya Uppal, Donghun Kang, Priyanka Mishra
summary: ReachOut is a mobile-web application for coordinating and communication between 5-6 different homeless outreach organizations. There are many organizations that support the homeless through outreach but there was little to no coordination between each organization. This resulted in individuals falling through the cracks and not getting the resources they needed.

title: Sentence Mosaics
team: Ashley Lai, Christie Chang, Eddie Dryer, Jackie Kang, Jennifer Chou, Lizzy Board, Mehar Sawhney, Ellie La, Sabrina Zhai, Grace Joseph, Michelle Sun, Kelly Wang, Stephen Tao, Kaylin Li, Erica Fu, Megan Strauss, Sashank Gogula
summary: Sentence Mosaics is a speech-language therapy app that simulates a color-tile foam board system to help students associate words with certain parts of speech and form sentences.
